content: I once described Medium to a colleague as the offspring of WordPress and Twitter. But it is and it isn’t. It has the things that we love(d) about WordPress and few of the ones we don’t (especially the stuff that makes WordPress feel too much like, well, Word). From Twitter, you get the sense that Medium spurs a whole new type of writing. That the Medium really does shape the message (no, I’m not the first to bastardise McLuhan today). Some people really do love screaming into the void, but so much of the powerful writing on Medium is more like sobbing, even if it’s sometimes written in ALL CAPS. The best pieces make you sob with them (1, 2). I’ve found stuff that helped me whip up thinking, re-evaluate, write better, laugh in despair. It’s less yelling in a crowd than talking in a bar. Sure, it’s noisy, but there are always interesting conversations and it feels like we’re all friends, even if it’s just the stupor of alcohol talking. Congratulations to the team, I can’t wait to see what renovations you make.
